post.description:
Schedules asynchronous history cleanup (See
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).

**Note:** This endpoint will return at most a single history cleanup job.
Since version `7.9.0` it is possible to configure multiple
[parallel history cleanup jobs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#parallel-execution). Use
[`GET /history/cleanup/jobs`](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/history-cleanup/get-history-cleanup-jobs)
to find all the available history cleanup jobs.

parameters.name: immediatelyDue
parameters.description:
When true the job will be scheduled for nearest future. When `false`, the job will be
scheduled for next batch window start time. Default is `true`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid or the engine
does not participate in history cleanup. See
[Cleanup Execution Participation per Node](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#cleanup-execution-participation-per-node).

get.description:
Retrieves history cleanup batch window configuration (See
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).

**Deprecated!** Use `GET /history/cleanup/jobs` instead.

Finds history cleanup job (See
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).

404.description: History clean up job does not exist.

get.description:
Finds history cleanup jobs (See
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).

404.description: History clean up jobs are empty.

get.description:
Retrieves a report about a decision definition and finished decision instances
relevant to history cleanup (see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)), 
so that you can tune the history time to live.
These reports include the count of the finished historic decision
instances, cleanable decision instances and basic decision definition
data - id, key, name and version.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the 
[Get Cleanable Decision Instance Report Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/decision-definition/get-cleanable-decision-instance-report-count/) method.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition keys.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant 
ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` 
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: compact
parameters.description:
Only include decision instances which have more than zero finished instances. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

500.description:
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

get.summary: Get Cleanable Decision Instance Report Count
get.description:
Queries for the number of report results about a decision definition and finished
decision instances relevant to history cleanup (see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).
Takes the same parameters as the [Get Cleanable Decision Instance Report](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/decision-definition/get-cleanable-decision-instance-report/) 
method.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition keys.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant 
ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` 
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: compact
parameters.description:
Only include decision instances which have more than zero finished instances. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

500.description:
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

Queries for historic decision instances that fulfill the given parameters. 
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the 
[Get Historic Decision Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/decision-instance/get-decision-instance-query-count/) 
method.

parameters.name: decisionInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by decision instance id.

parameters.name: decisionInstanceIdIn

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the decision definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn

Filter by the decision definitions the instances belongs to. Must be a
comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionKeyIn

separated list of decision definition keys.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to, that the parameter
is a substring of.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the process definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the process instance the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the case definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the case definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the case instance the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by the activity ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by the activity instance ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A historic decision instance must have one
of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic decision instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: evaluatedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: evaluatedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that were evaluated by the given user.

parameters.name: rootDecisionInstanceId
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that have a given root decision instance id.
This also includes the decision instance with the given id.

parameters.name: rootDecisionInstancesOnly
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances those are the root decision instance of an evaluation.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: includeInputs
parameters.description:
Include input values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeOutputs
parameters.description:
Include output values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableBinaryFetching
parameters.description:
Disables fetching of byte array input and output values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableCustomObjectDeserialization
parameters.description:
Disables deserialization of input and output values that are custom objects.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Delete multiple historic decision instances asynchronously (batch).
At least `historicDecisionInstanceIds` or `historicDecisionInstanceQuery` 
has to be provided. If both are provided then all instances matching query 
criterion and instances from the list will be deleted.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, i.e. neither
`historicDecisionInstanceIds` nor `historicDecisionInstanceQuery` is
present. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) 
for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the removal time to multiple historic decision instances asynchronously
(batch).

At least `historicDecisionInstanceIds` or
`historicDecisionInstanceQuery` has to be provided. If both are
provided, all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list
will be updated with a removal time.

400.description:
Request was unsuccessfull due to a bad user request. This occurs if
some of the query parameters are invalid, e. g. if neither
historicDecisionInstances nor historicDecisionInstanceQuery is
present or if no mode is specified.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a historic decision instance by id, according to the 
`HistoricDecisionInstance` interface in the engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic decision instance to be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeInputs
parameters.description:
Include input values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeOutputs
parameters.description:
Include output values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableBinaryFetching
parameters.description:
Disables fetching of byte array input and output values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableCustomObjectDeserialization
parameters.description:
Disables deserialization of input and output values that are custom objects.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

404.description:
Historic decision instance with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves evaluation statistics of a given decision requirements definition.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the decision requirements definition.

parameters.name: decisionInstanceId
parameters.description:
Restrict query results to be based only on specific evaluation
instance of a given decision requirements definition.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for historic details that fulfill the given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Historic Detail Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/detail/get-detail-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by process instance id.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic details which belong to one of the passed comma-separated process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Filter by execution id.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Filter by task id.

parameters.name: activityInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by activity instance id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by case instance id.

parameters.name: caseExecutionId
parameters.description: Filter by case execution id.

parameters.name: variableInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by variable instance id.

parameters.name: variableTypeIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic details where the variable updates belong to one of the passed comma-separated
list of variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type `serializable`.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by variable name like. Example usage: `variableNameLike(%camunda%)`. The query will match the names of variables in a case-insensitive way.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic details that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: userOperationId
parameters.description: Filter by a user operation id.

parameters.name: formFields
parameters.description: Only include `HistoricFormFields`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: variableUpdates
parameters.description: Only include `HistoricVariableUpdates`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: excludeTaskDetails
parameters.description:
Excludes all task-related `HistoricDetails`, so only items which have no task id set will be selected.
When this parameter is used together with `taskId`, this call is ignored and task details are not excluded.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description:
Restrict to historic variable updates that contain only initial variable values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: occurredBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured before the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

parameters.name: occurredAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured after the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for historic details that fulfill the given parameters. This method is slightly more
powerful than the [Get Historic Details](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/detail/get-detail-query/)
method because it allows sorting by multiple parameters. The size of the result set can be retrieved by
using the [Get Historic Detail Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/detail/get-detail-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: firstResult

parameters.name: maxResults

Will return less results if there are no more results left.

variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing

parameters.name: deserializeValue

get.description:
Retrieves the content of a historic variable update by id. Applicable for byte
array and file variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic variable update.

schema.description: For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: binary variable: Status 200. Content-Type: application/octet-stream

schema.description:
File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally,
                            for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

get.description:
Queries for historic external task logs that fulfill the given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get External Task Log Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/external-task-log/get-external-task-log-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: logId
parameters.description: Filter by historic external task log id.

parameters.name: externalTaskId
parameters.description: Filter by external task id.

parameters.name: topicName
parameters.description: Filter by an external task topic.

parameters.name: workerId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: Filter by external task exception message.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed activity ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed activity
instance ids.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed execution ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by process instance id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by process definition key.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic external task log entries which belong to one of the passed and
comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic external task log entries that belong to no tenant. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include logs for which the associated external task had a priority lower than or
equal to the given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include logs for which the associated external task had a priority higher than or
equal to the given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

parameters.name: creationLog
parameters.description: Only include creation logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: failureLog
parameters.description: Only include failure logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: successLog
parameters.description: Only include success logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: deletionLog
parameters.description: Only include deletion logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

get.description:
Queries for historic incidents that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Incident Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/incident/get-incident-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to the given incident type. See the [User
Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident message.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that incidents message is a substring of the given value.
The string can include the wildcard character '%' to express
like-strategy: starts with (string%), ends with (%string) or contains
(%string%).

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given processDefinitionKey.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given process definition keys.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: createTimeBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have a createTime date before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: createTimeAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have a createTime date after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: endTimeBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an endTimeBefore date before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: endTimeAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an endTimeAfter date after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that were created due to the failure of an activity with the given
id.

parameters.name: causeIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as cause incident.

parameters.name: rootCauseIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as root cause incident.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as configuration.

parameters.name: historyConfiguration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as history configuration.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that are open.

parameters.name: resolved
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that are resolved.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that are deleted.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic incidents that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated job definition ids.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.

parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.

get.description:
Retrieves the corresponding exception stacktrace to the passed historic job log by
id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic job log to get the exception stacktrace for.

schema.description: Returns the stacktrace of the exception for the historic job with the given ID.

example-1.description:
GET `history/job-log/someId/stacktrace`

                                       The result is the corresponding stacktrace as plain text.
example-1.value:
java.lang.RuntimeException: A exception message!
                                  at org.camunda.bpm.pa.service.FailingDelegate.execute(FailingDelegate.java:10)
                                  at org.camunda.bpm.engine.impl.delegate.JavaDelegateInvocation.invoke(JavaDelegateInvocation.java:34)
                                  at org.camunda.bpm.engine.impl.delegate.DelegateInvocation.proceed(DelegateInvocation.java:37)
                                  ...

404.description:
Historic job log with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)

get.description:
Retrieves a report about a process definition and finished process instances
relevant to history cleanup (see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)) 
so that you can tune the history time to live.
These reports include the count of the finished historic process
instances, cleanable process instances and basic process definition
data - id, key, name and version.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Cleanable Process Instance Report Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/process-definition/get-cleanable-process-instance-report-count/)
method.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A process definition must have one of the given 
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include process definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: compact
parameters.description:
Only include process instances which have more than zero finished instances. Value may
only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

500.description:
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves historic statistics of a given process definition, grouped by activities.
These statistics include the number of running activity instances and,
optionally, the number of canceled activity instances, finished
activity instances and activity instances which completed a scope
(i.e., in BPMN 2.0 manner: a scope is completed by an activity
instance when the activity instance consumed a token but did not emit
a new token).
**Note:** This only includes historic data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition.

parameters.name: canceled
parameters.description:
Whether to include the number of canceled activity instances in the result or not. Valid
values are `true` or `false`. Default: `false`.

parameters.name: finished
parameters.description:
Whether to include the number of finished activity instances in the result or not. Valid
values are `true` or `false`. Default: `false`.

parameters.name: completeScope
parameters.description:
Whether to include the number of activity instances which completed a scope in the result
or not. Valid values are `true` or `false`. Default: `false`.

parameters.name: incidents
parameters.description: Whether to include the number of incidents. Valid values are `true` or `false`. Default: `false`.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to process instances that were started before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), 
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, 
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to process instances that were started after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), 
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, 
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to process instances that were finished before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), 
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, 
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to process instances that were finished after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), 
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, 
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances with an active activity with one of the given ids. In contrast to the `activeActivityIdIn` filter, it can query for async and incident activities. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: executedActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that executed an activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are suspended.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are completed.

parameters.name: externallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are externallyTerminated.

parameters.name: internallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:
A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`. `key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as String objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

Key and value may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

parameters.description: Filter by a list of tenant ids. A process instance must have one of the given tenant ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only include historic process instances which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances with an active activity with one of the given ids. In contrast to the `activeActivityIdIn` filter, it can query for async and incident activities. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: executedActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that executed an activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: activeActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that have an active activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are active.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are suspended.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are completed.

parameters.name: externallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are externallyTerminated.

parameters.name: internallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:
A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`. `key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as String objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

Key and value may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for the number of historic process instances that fulfill the given parameters.
This method takes the same message body as the [Get Process Instances (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/process-instance/get-process-instance-query/) method and
therefore it is slightly more powerful than the [Get Process Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/process-instance/post-process-instance-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Delete multiple historic process instances asynchronously (batch).
At least `historicProcessInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery` has to be provided.
If both are provided then all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list will be deleted.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, i.e. neither historicProcessInstanceIds,
nor historicProcessInstanceQuery is present. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a report about the duration of completed process instances, grouped by a period.
These reports include the maximum, minimum and average duration of all completed process instances which were started in a given period.

**Note:** This only includes historic data.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description:
**Mandatory.** Specifies the type of the report to retrieve.
To retrieve a report about the duration of process instances, the value must be set to `duration`.

parameters.name: periodUnit
parameters.description: **Mandatory.** Specifies the granularity of the report. Valid values are `month` and `quarter`.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date.
By [default](), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2016-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2016-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid or mandatory parameters are not supplied.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

403.description:
If the authenticated user is unauthorized to read the history.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the removal time to multiple historic process instances asynchronously (batch).

At least `historicProcessInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery` has to be provided.
If both are provided, all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list will be updated with a removal time.

400.description:
Bad Request
Request was unsuccessfull due to a bad user request. This occurs if some of the query parameters are invalid,
e. g. if neither `historicProcessInstances` nor `historicProcessInstanceQuery` is present or if no mode is specified.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

delete.description: Deletes a process instance from the history by id.

parameters.name: failIfNotExists
parameters.description: If set to `false`, the request will still be successful if the process id is not found.

404.description:
Not found
Historic process instance with given id does not exist.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for historic tasks that fulfill the given parameters. This method is slightly more powerful
than the [Get Tasks (Historic)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/task/get-task-query/) method because
it allows filtering by multiple process or task variables of types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Task Count (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/task/post-task-query-count/)
method.

for the error response format.

[Get Tasks (Historic) (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/task/post-task-query/)
method and takes the same parameters.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a report of completed tasks. When the report type is set to `count`, the
report contains a list of completed task counts where an entry contains the task name, the
definition key of the task, the process definition id, the process definition key, the process
definition name and the count of how many tasks were completed for the specified key in a given
period. When the report type is set to `duration`, the report contains a minimum, maximum and
average duration value of all completed task instances in a given period.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description:
**Mandatory.** Specifies the kind of the report to execute. To retrieve a report
about the duration of process instances the value must be set to `duration`. For a
report of the completed tasks in a specific timespan the value must be set to `count`.

parameters.name: periodUnit
parameters.description:
When the report type is set to `duration`, this parameter is **mandatory**.
Specifies the granularity of the report. Valid values are `month` and `quarter`.

parameters.name: completedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were completed before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: completedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were completed after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description:
When the report type is set to `count`, this parameter is **mandatory**. Groups the
tasks report by a given criterion. Valid values are `taskName` and `processDefinition`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `completedAfter`
parameter is supplied, but the date format is wrong. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for user operation log entries that fulfill the given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get User Operation Log Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/user-operation-log/get-user-operation-log-query-count/)
method.

Note that the properties of operation log entries are interpreted as
restrictions on the entities they apply to. That means, if a single
process instance is updated, the field `processInstanceId` is
populated. If a single operation updates all process instances of the
same process definition, the field `processInstanceId` is `null` (a
`null` restriction is viewed as a wildcard, i.e., matches a process
instance with any id) and the field `processDefinitionId` is
populated. This way, which entities were changed by a user operation
can easily be reconstructed.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by deployment id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by process definition key.

parameters.description: Filter by process instance id.

[Javadoc](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/javadoc/?org/camunda/bpm/engine/history/UserOperationLogEntry.html)
for a list of available operation types.

parameters.name: entityType
parameters.description:
Filter by the type of the entity that was affected by this operation, possible values are
`Task`, `Attachment` or `IdentityLink`.

parameters.name: entityTypeIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of types of the entities that was affected by this operation,
possible values are `Task`, `Attachment` or `IdentityLink`.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
Filter by the category that this operation is associated with, possible values are
`TaskWorker`, `Admin` or `Operator`.

parameters.name: categoryIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of categories that this operation is associated with, possible values are
`TaskWorker`, `Admin` or `Operator`.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Only include operations that changed this property, e.g., `owner` or `assignee`.

parameters.name: afterTimestamp
parameters.description:
Restrict to entries that were created after the given timestamp. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
timestamp must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

parameters.name: beforeTimestamp
parameters.description:
Restrict to entries that were created before the given timestamp. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
timestamp must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

example-2.summary: Gets an operation that updates a multiple process instances with the same key.

get.description:
Queries for historic variable instances that fulfill the given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Variable Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/variable-instance/get-variable-instance-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: Filter by variable name.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to variables with a name like the parameter.

parameters.name: variableValue
parameters.description: Filter by variable value. Is treated as a `String` object on server side.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match the variable name provided in `variableName` and `variableNameLike` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match the variable value provided in `variableValue` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableTypeIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type
'serializable'.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Include variables that has already been deleted during the execution.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the process instance the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated process instance ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the process definition the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by a key of the process definition the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated execution ids.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the case instance the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: caseExecutionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated case execution ids.

parameters.name: caseActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated case activity ids.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated task ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated activity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: variableNameIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated variable names.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

This method is slightly more powerful than the

method because it allows filtering by variable values of the different
types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

parameters.name: firstResult

get.description:
A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
policy compliant. This end point returns a JSON representation of the
list of policy rules. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
the [security instructions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/security/).

200.description:
Request successful. This example uses the built-in password policy that enforces a minimum password length,
and some complexity rules.

404.description: No password policy was found.

post.description:
A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
policy compliant. A password can be checked for compliancy via this
end point. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
the [security instructions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/security/).

200.description:
Request successful. This example uses the built-in password policy that enforces a minimum password length, and
some complexity rules. The checked password is myPassword which is not complex enough to match all of
the policy rules.

404.description: No password policy was found to check the password against.

post.description: Verifies that user credentials are valid.

400.description: If body does not contain username or password.

get.description:
Queries for incidents that fulfill given parameters. The size of the result set can be retrieved by using
the [Get Incident Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/incident/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to the given incident type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident
types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident message.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that incidents message is a substring of the given value. The string can include
the wildcard character '%' to express like-strategy: starts with (`string%`), ends with (`%string`) or
contains (`%string%`).

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given keys. Must be a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date before the given date. 
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date after the given date. 
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

get.description:
Queries for jobs that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get Job
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/job/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Filter by job id.

parameters.name: jobIds
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of job ids.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given job definition.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given process instance.

parameters.name: processInstanceIds
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given comma-separated list of process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given execution.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process definition the jobs run on.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the jobs run on.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: executable
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which are executable, i.e., retries > 0 and due date is `null` or due
date is in the past. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: timers
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are timers. Cannot be used together with `messages`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: messages
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are messages. Cannot be used together with `timers`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: dueDates
parameters.description:
Only select jobs where the due date is lower or higher than the given date.
Due date expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: createTimes
parameters.description:
Only select jobs created before or after the given date.

Create time expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: withException
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that failed due to an exception. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is
the default behavior.

parameters.name: exceptionMessage
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception with the given message.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception at an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have no retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only include active jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Only include suspended jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Only include jobs which belong to one of the passed comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include jobs which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: includeJobsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include jobs which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for due date comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

Queries for jobs that fulfill given parameters. This method is slightly more
powerful than the [Get Jobs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/job/get-query/)
method because it allows filtering by multiple jobs of types `String`,
`Number` or `Boolean`.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults

Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`

for due date comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)

parameters.name: processDefinitionId

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey

[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job types.

parameters.name: jobConfiguration
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions which exist for the given job configuration. For example: for
timer jobs it is the timer configuration.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active job definitions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended job definitions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: withOverridingJobPriority
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions that have an overriding job priority defined. The only
effective value is `true`. If set to `false`, this filter is not applied.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated tenant
ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId

parameters.name: includeJobDefinitionsWithoutTenantId

Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:

Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
Returned if some of the request parameters are invalid, for example if the provided
`executionDate` parameter doesn't have the expected format. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a job definition by id, according to the `JobDefinition` interface in the engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to be retrieved.

404.description:
Job definition with given id does not exist.  See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.summary: Set Job Definition Priority by Id
put.description:
Sets an overriding execution priority for jobs with the given definition id.
Optionally, the priorities of all the definitions' existing jobs are
updated accordingly. The priority can be reset by setting it to
`null`, meaning that a new job's priority will not be determined based
on its definition's priority any longer. See the
[user guide on job prioritization](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#set-job-definition-priorities-via-managementservice-api)
for details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to be updated.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

404.description:
Job definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
The retries could not be set successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.summary: Set Job Retries By Job Definition Id
put.description:
Sets the number of retries of all **failed** jobs associated with the given job
definition id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to be updated.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

500.description:
The retries could not be set successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.description: Activates or suspends a given job definition by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to activate or suspend.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

for the error response format.

post.description:
Correlates a message to the process engine to either trigger a message start event or an intermediate message 
catching event. Internally this maps to the engine's message correlation builder methods
`MessageCorrelationBuilder#correlateWithResult()` and `MessageCorrelationBuilder#correlateAllWithResult()`.
For more information about the correlation behavior, see the [Message Events](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/bpmn20/events/message-events/)
section of the [BPMN 2.0 Implementation Reference](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/bpmn20/).

example-1.description: The Response content of a status 200. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `false` (Default).

example-2.description: The Response content of a status 200. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `true`.

200.description:
Request successful. The property `resultEnabled` in the request body was `true`.
The `variables` property is only returned, if the property variablesInResultEnable`
was set to `true` in the request.

204.description: Request successful. The property `resultEnabled` in the request body was `false` (Default).

400.description:
Returned if:
* no `messageName` was supplied
* both `tenantId` and `withoutTenantId` are supplied
* the message has not been correlated to exactly one entity (execution or process definition)
* the variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a list of metrics, aggregated for a given interval.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the metric.

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description:
The name of the reporter (host), on which the metrics was logged. This will have
value provided by the [hostname configuration property](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/deployment-descriptors/tags/process-engine/#hostname).

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date (inclusive).

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date (exclusive).

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
The interval for which the metrics should be aggregated. Time unit is seconds.
Default: The interval is set to 15 minutes (900 seconds).

parameters.name: aggregateByReporter
parameters.description: Aggregate metrics by reporter.

400.description: Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.

delete.description: Deletes all task worker metrics prior to the given date or all if no date is provided.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date prior to which all task worker metrics should be deleted.

403.description: If the user who performs the operation is not a camunda-admin user.

parameters.name: metrics-name
parameters.description: The name of the metric.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date (inclusive).
