parameters.description: The end date (exclusive).

post.description:
Executes a migration plan synchronously for multiple process instances. To execute
a migration plan asynchronously, use the
[Execute Migration Plan Async(Batch)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/migration/execute-migration-async/)
method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous
execution of a migration plan, please refer to the related section of
[the user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration/#executing-a-migration-plan).

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
The request is not valid if one or more of the following statements apply:

* The provided migration plan is not valid, so an exception of type
`MigrationPlanValidationException` is returned.
* The provided migration plan is not valid for a specific process
instance it is applied to, so an exception of type
`MigratingProcessInstanceValidationException` is returned.
* In case additional parameters of the request are unexpected, an
exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Executes a migration plan asynchronously (batch) for multiple process instances.
To execute a migration plan synchronously, use the
[Execute MigrationPlan](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/migration/execute-migration/)
method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous
execution of a migration plan, please refer to the related section of
[the user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration/#executing-a-migration-plan).

400.description:
The request is not valid if one or more of the following statements apply:

* The provided migration plan is not valid, so an exception of type
`MigrationPlanValidationException` is returned.
* In case additional parameters of the request are unexpected, an
exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Generates a migration plan for two process definitions. The generated migration
plan contains migration instructions which map equal activities
between the
two process definitions.

400.description:
The requested migration was invalid. See
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Validates a migration plan statically without executing it. This
corresponds to the
[creation time validation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration/#creation-time-validation)
described in the user guide.

failures: Cannot set variable with name foo. Java serialization format is prohibited

200.description: Request successful. The validation report was returned.

400.description:
In case additional parameters of the request are unexpected, an
exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Executes a modification synchronously for multiple process instances.
To modify a single process instance, use the
[Modify Process Instance Execution State](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/process-instance/post-modification/) method.
To execute a modification asynchronously, use the
[Execute Modification Async (Batch)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/modification/post-modification-async/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and
asynchronous execution of a modification, please refer to the related
section of the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration.md#executing-a-migration-plan).

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

400.description:
In case following parameters are missing: instructions,
processDefinitionId, activityId or transitionId, processInstanceIds
or processInstanceQuery, an exception of type
`InvalidRequestException` is returned. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Executes a modification asynchronously for multiple process instances. To execute a
modification synchronously, use the
[Execute Modification](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/modification/post-modification-sync/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and
asynchronous execution of a modification, please refer to the related
section of the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration.md#executing-a-migration-plan).

400.description:
In case following parameters are missing: instructions,
processDefinitionId, activityId or transitionId, processInstanceIds
or processInstanceQuery, an exception of type
`InvalidRequestException` is returned. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for process definitions that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the properties of 
process definitions, such as the name, key or version. The size of the result set can be retrieved
by using the [Get Definition Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/process-definition/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by process definition name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: deployedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the process definition belongs to.
Only selects process definitions that have been deployed after (exclusive) a specific time.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: deployedAt
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the process definition belongs to.
Only selects process definitions that have been deployed at a specific time (exact match).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter by process definition key, i.e., the id in the BPMN 2.0 XML. Exact match.

parameters.name: keysIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: keyLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by process definition category. Exact match.

parameters.name: categoryLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition categories that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by process definition version.

parameters.name: latestVersion
parameters.description:
Only include those process definitions that are latest versions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the process definition resource. Exact match.

parameters.name: resourceNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by names of those process definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: startableBy
parameters.description: Filter by a user name who is allowed to start the process.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active process definitions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended process definitions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Filter by the incident type.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
A process definition must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include process definitions which belong to no tenant.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeProcessDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include process definitions which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: versionTag
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag.

parameters.name: versionTagLike
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: withoutVersionTag
parameters.description: Only include process definitions without a `versionTag`.

parameters.name: startableInTasklist
parameters.description: Filter by process definitions which are startable in Tasklist..

parameters.name: notStartableInTasklist
parameters.description: Filter by process definitions which are not startable in Tasklist.

parameters.name: startablePermissionCheck
parameters.description:
Filter by process definitions which the user is allowed to start in Tasklist.
If the user doesn't have these permissions the result will be empty list.
The permissions are:
* `CREATE` permission for all Process instances
* `CREATE_INSTANCE` and `READ` permission on Process definition level

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

delete.description: Deletes process definitions by a given key which belong to no tenant id.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definitions to be deleted.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description:
`true`, if all process instances, historic process instances and jobs
for this process definition should be deleted.

parameters.name: skipCustomListeners
parameters.description: `true`, if only the built-in ExecutionListeners should be notified with the end event.

parameters.name: skipIoMappings
parameters.description:
A boolean value to control whether input/output mappings should be executed during deletion.
`true`, if input/output mappings should not be invoked.

403.description:
Forbidden
The process definitions with the given `key` cannot be deleted due to missing permissions.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Not found
Process definition with given `key` does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves the latest version of the process definition which belongs to no tenant according to the `ProcessDefinition` interface in the engine.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

400.description:
Process definition with given `key` does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)

get.description:
Retrieves the deployed form that can be referenced from a start event.
For further information please refer to [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/task-forms/#embedded-task-forms).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

schema.description: For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: (e.g. "Great Pizza for Everyone Inc.")

400.description:
The form key has wrong format.  See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
The deployed start form cannot be retrieved due to missing permissions on process definition resource.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
No deployed start form for a given process definition exists. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)

get.description:
Retrieves the diagram for the latest version of the process definition which belongs to no tenant.

If the process definition's deployment contains an image resource with the same file name
as the process definition, the deployed image will be returned by the Get Diagram endpoint.
Example: `someProcess.bpmn` and `someProcess.png`.
Supported file extentions for the image are: `svg`, `png`, `jpg`, and `gif`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition.

200.description: Request successful. The image diagram of this process.

schema.description: defaults to `application/octet-stream` if the file suffix is unknown
Files with MIME type information image/png, image/gif, ...

204.description: The process definition doesn't have an associated diagram.

404.description:
Process definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the start form variables for the latest process definition which belongs to no tenant
(only if they are defined via the 
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms) approach).
The start form variables take form data specified on the start event into account.
If form fields are defined, the variable types and default values
of the form fields are taken into account.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

**Note**: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
The key is null or does not exist. See the

set the feature flag `enforceHistoryTimeToLive` to `false`. Read more in [Configuration Properties]
(https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/deployment-descriptors/tags/process-engine#configuration-properties)

get.description:
Retrieves runtime statistics of the latest version of the given process definition
which belongs to no tenant, grouped by activities.
These statistics include the number of running activity instances, optionally the number of failed jobs
and also optionally the number of incidents either grouped by incident types or
for a specific incident type.
**Note**: This does not include historic data.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: failedJobs
parameters.description: Whether to include the number of failed jobs in the result or not. Valid values are `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: incidents
parameters.description:
Valid values for this property are `true` or `false`.
If this property has been set to `true` the result will include the corresponding number of incidents
for each occurred incident type.
If it is set to `false`, the incidents will not be included in the result.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidentsForType`.

parameters.name: incidentsForType
parameters.description:
If this property has been set with any incident type (i.e., a string value) the result
will only include the number of incidents for the assigned incident type.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidents`.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

get.description:
Retrieves the diagram for the latest version of the process definition for tenant.

If the process definition's deployment contains an image resource with the same file name
as the process definition, the deployed image will be returned by the Get Diagram endpoint.
Example: `someProcess.bpmn` and `someProcess.png`.
Supported file extentions for the image are: `svg`, `png`, `jpg`, and `gif`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definition belongs to.

200.description: Request successful. The image diagram of this process.

schema.description: defaults to `application/octet-stream` if the file suffix is unknown
Files with MIME type information image/png, image/gif, ...

204.description: The process definition doesn't have an associated diagram.

404.description:
Process definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the start form variables for the latest process definition for a tenant
(only if they are defined via the 
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms) approach).
The start form variables take form data specified on the start event into account.
If form fields are defined, the variable types and default values
of the form fields are taken into account.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definition belongs to.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

**Note**: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

The key is null or does not exist. See the

for the error response format.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<definitions
                         xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL"
                         xmlns:camunda="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/bpmn"
                         targetNamespace="Examples">
                         <process id="oneTaskProcess" isExecutable="true">
                           <startEvent id="theStart" />
                           <sequenceFlow id="flow1" sourceRef="theStart" targetRef="theEnd" />
                           <endEvent id="theEnd" />
                         </process>
                       </definitions>

for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the diagram of a process definition.

If the process definition's deployment contains an image resource with the same file name
as the process definition, the deployed image will be returned by the Get Diagram endpoint.
Example: `someProcess.bpmn` and `someProcess.png`.
Supported file extentions for the image are: `svg`, `png`, `jpg`, and `gif`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition.

200.description: Request successful. The image diagram of this process.

schema.description: defaults to `application/octet-stream` if the file suffix is unknown
Files with MIME type information image/png, image/gif, ...

204.description: The process definition doesn't have an associated diagram.

404.description:
Process definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the start form variables for a process definition
(only if they are defined via the 
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms) approach).
The start form variables take form data specified on the start event into account.
If form fields are defined, the variable types and default values
of the form fields are taken into account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition to retrieve the variables for.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

**Note**: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
The id is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.description:
Updates history time to live for process definition.
The field is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).
The value of the update is mandatory by default and does not allow `null` values. To enable them, please
set the feature flag `enforceHistoryTimeToLive` to `false`. Read more in [Configuration Properties]
(https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/deployment-descriptors/tags/process-engine#configuration-properties)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition to change history time to live.

post.description:

Can also restart completed process instances.
It will create a new instance using the original instance information.
To execute the restart asynchronously, use the
[Restart Process Instance Async](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/process-definition/post-restart-process-instance-async/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous execution,
please refer to the related section of the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-restart/#execution).

get.description:
For the given process, returns a list of called process definitions corresponding
to
the `CalledProcessDefinition` interface in the engine. The list
contains all process definitions
that are referenced statically by call activities in the given
process. This endpoint does not
resolve process definitions that are referenced with expressions. Each
called process definition
contains a list of call activity ids, which specifies the call
activities that are calling that
process. This endpoint does not resolve references to case
definitions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves runtime statistics of a given process definition, grouped by activities.
These statistics include the number of running activity instances, optionally the number of failed jobs
and also optionally the number of incidents either grouped by incident types or for a specific incident type.
**Note**: This does not include historic data.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition.

parameters.name: failedJobs
parameters.description: Whether to include the number of failed jobs in the result or not. Valid values are `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: incidents
parameters.description:
Valid values for this property are `true` or `false`.
If this property has been set to `true` the result will include the corresponding number of incidents
for each occurred incident type.
If it is set to `false`, the incidents will not be included in the result.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidentsForType`.

parameters.name: incidentsForType
parameters.description:
If this property has been set with any incident type (i.e., a string value) the result
will only include the number of incidents for the assigned incident type.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidents`.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

get.description:
Queries for process instances that fulfill given parameters.
Parameters may be static as well as dynamic runtime properties of process instances.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the Get Instance Count method.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: processInstanceIds
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process instance ids.

parameters.name: businessKey
parameters.description: Filter by process instance business key.

parameters.name: businessKeyLike
parameters.description: Filter by process instance business key that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by case instance id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances run on.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition keys.
A process instance must have one of the given process definition keys.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyNotIn
parameters.description:
Exclude instances by a comma-separated list of process definition keys.
A process instance must not have one of the given process definition keys.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: superProcessInstance
parameters.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given process instance.
Takes a process instance id.

parameters.name: subProcessInstance
parameters.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that have the given process instance as a sub process instance.
Takes a process instance id.

parameters.name: superCaseInstance
parameters.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance.
Takes a case instance id.

parameters.name: subCaseInstance
parameters.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that have the given case instance as a sub case instance.
Takes a case instance id.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active process instances. Value may only be true,
as false is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended process instances. Value may only be true,
as false is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withIncident
parameters.description: Filter by presence of incidents. Selects only process instances that have an incident.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Filter by the incident type.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A process instance must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only include process instances which belong to no tenant.

parameters.name: processDefinitionWithoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only include process instances which process definition has no tenant id.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of activity ids.
A process instance must currently wait in a leaf activity with one of the given activity ids.

parameters.name: rootProcessInstances
parameters.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are top level process instances.

parameters.name: leafProcessInstances
parameters.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are leaf instances. (i.e. don't have any sub instances).

parameters.name: variables
variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively.
If set to true variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively.
If set to true variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if a sortOrder parameter is supplied, but no sortBy, or if an invalid operator for variable comparison is used.

post.description:
Submits a list of modification instructions to change a process instance's execution state.
A modification instruction is one of the following:

* Starting execution before an activity
* Starting execution after an activity on its single outgoing sequence flow
* Starting execution on a specific sequence flow
* Canceling an activity instance, transition instance, or all instances (activity or transition) for an activity

Instructions are executed immediately and in the order they are provided in this request's body.
Variables can be provided with every starting instruction.

The exact semantics of modification can be read about in the [User guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-modification/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to modify.

400.description: At least one modification instruction misses required parameters.

500.description: The modification cannot be performed, for example because it starts a failing activity.

post.summary: Modify Process Instance Execution State Async
post.description:
Submits a list of modification instructions to change a process instance's execution state async.
A modification instruction is one of the following:

* Starting execution before an activity
* Starting execution after an activity on its single outgoing sequence flow
* Starting execution on a specific sequence flow
* Cancelling an activity instance, transition instance, or all instances (activity or transition) for an activity

Instructions are executed asynchronous and in the order they are provided in this request's body.
Variables can be provided with every starting instruction.

The exact semantics of modification can be read about in the
[User guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-modification/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to modify.

400.description:
Bad Request
At least one modification instruction misses required parameters.

403.description:
Forbidden
If the user is not allowed to execute batches. See the Introduction for the error response format.

500.description: The modification cannot be performed, for example because it starts a failing activity.

put.description: Activates or suspends a given process instance by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to activate or suspend.

get.description: Retrieves all variables of a given process instance by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variables from.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to false
when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

500.description: Process instance with given id does not exist.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables of a process instance by id. Updates precede deletions.
So, if a variable is updated AND deleted, the deletion overrides the update.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to set variables for.

400.description:
Bad Request
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value or
the passed variable type is not supported.

500.description: Update or delete could not be executed, for example because the process instance does not exist.

delete.description: Deletes a variable of a process instance by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to delete the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to delete.

get.description: Retrieves a variable of a given process instance by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to false
when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

400.description:
Bad Request
Variable with given id does not exist.

put.description: Sets a variable of a given process instance by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to set the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to set.

400.description:
Bad Request
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value or
the passed variable type is not supported.

get.description:
Retrieves the content of a Process Variable by the Process Instance id and the Process Variable name.
Applicable for byte array or file Process Variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

200.description:
Request successful.
        For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.
        File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
        Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: Content-Type: application/octet-stream

schema.description:
File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
            Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

example-1.value: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="someFile.txt"

400.description:
Bad Request
A Process Variable with the given id exists but does not serialize as binary data.

404.description:
Not Found
A Process Variable with the given id does not exist.

post.description: Sets the serialized value for a binary variable or the binary value for a file variable.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

requestBody.description: For binary variables a multipart form submit with the following parts:

example-1.description: Post binary content of a byte array variable.
example-1.value:
```
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="image.png"
                        Content-Type: application/octet-stream
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-2.description: Post the JSON serialization of a Java Class (**deprecated**).
example-2.value:
```
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="type"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"
                        Content-Type: application/json; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        ["foo","bar"]
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-3.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="myFile.txt"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        File
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

400.description:
Bad Request
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if no filename is set.

get.description: Queries for schema log entries that fulfill given parameters.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Only return schema log entries with a specific version.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

example-1.description: The Response content of a status 200

200.description:
Request successful.
**Note**: In order to get any results a user of group `camunda-admin` must
be authenticated.

Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

200.description:

**Note**: In order to get any results a user of group camunda-admin must be
