post.description:
A signal is an event of global scope (broadcast semantics) and is delivered to all
active handlers. Internally this maps to the engine's signal event received builder
method `RuntimeService#createSignalEvent()`. For more information about the signal
behavior, see the [Signal Events](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/bpmn20/events/signal-events/)
section of the [BPMN 2.0 Implementation Reference](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/bpmn20/).

examle-1.description: The content of the Request Body

400.description:
Returned if:

* no name was given
* the variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be
parsed to an integer value or the passed variable type is not supported
* a tenant id and an execution id is specified.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

403.description:
Returned if the user is not allowed to throw a signal event.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

500.description:
Returned if a single execution is specified and no such execution exists or has not
subscribed to the signal.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

get.description:
Queries for tasks that fulfill a given filter. The size of the result set can be
retrieved by using the Get Task Count method.

**Security Consideration:** There are several query parameters (such as
assigneeExpression) for specifying an EL expression. These are disabled by default to
prevent remote code execution. See the section on
[security considerations](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
for custom code in the user guide for details.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Restrict to task with the given id.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with any of the given ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given id.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key which 
is described by an expression. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with one of the give business keys. 
The keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring and is described by an expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given key.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with one of the given keys. The 
keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given name.

parameters.name: processDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process definition name that has the parameter value as 
a substring.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given business key.

parameters.name: caseInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case instance business key that has the parameter value 
as a substring.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given id.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given key.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given name.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case definition name that has the parameter value as a 
substring.

parameters.name: caseExecutionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case execution with the given id.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated activity 
instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated 
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user is assigned to.

parameters.name: assigneeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression is assigned to. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: assigneeLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter value described by the 
given expression as a substring. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are assigned to one of the passed and 
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: assigneeNotIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are not assigned to one of the passed and
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user owns.

parameters.name: ownerExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression owns. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateGroup
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given group.

parameters.name: candidateGroupLike
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to groups that have the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: candidateGroupExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the group described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateUser
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given user or to one of his groups.

parameters.name: candidateUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the user described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: includeAssignedTasks
parameters.description:
Also include tasks that are assigned to users in candidate queries. Default is to only 
include tasks that are not assigned to any user if you query by candidate user or
group(s).

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the given user is involved in. A user is involved in a task if 
an identity link exists between task and user (e.g., the user is the assignee).

parameters.name: involvedUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the user described by the given expression is involved in.
A user is involved in a task if an identity link exists between task and user
(e.g., the user is the assignee). See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are assigned.

parameters.name: unassigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given key.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have one of the given keys. The keys need to be in a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a key that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given name.

parameters.name: nameNotEqual
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that do not have the given name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a name with the given parameter value as substring.

parameters.name: nameNotLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that do not have a name with the given parameter
value as substring.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

parameters.name: descriptionLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a description that has the parameter
value as a substring.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given priority.

parameters.name: maxPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a lower or equal priority.

parameters.name: minPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a higher or equal priority.

parameters.name: dueDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: dueDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the date described by the given expression. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.435+0200`.

parameters.name: dueAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.243+0200`.

parameters.name: dueBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: withoutDueDate
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no due date. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: followUpDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.542+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.234+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistent
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.432+0200`. The
typical use case is to query all `active` tasks for a user for a given date.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistentExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the date
described by the given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdOn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.324+0200`.

parameters.name: createdOnExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: createdAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: createdBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the given date. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must
have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: updatedAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the date described by the given expression. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: delegationState
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are in the given delegation state. Valid values are
`PENDING` and `RESOLVED`.

parameters.name: candidateGroups
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the given candidate groups. Takes a
comma-separated list of group names, so for example `developers,support,sales`.

parameters.name: candidateGroupsExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the candidate groups described by the
given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to
`java.util.List` of Strings.

parameters.name: withCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate user. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate users. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: taskVariables
processVariables
caseInstanceVariables
variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableName` and `variablename` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableValue` and `variablevalue` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: parentTaskId
parameters.description: Restrict query to all tasks that are sub tasks of the given task. Takes a task id.

parameters.name: withCommentAttachmentInfo
parameters.description:
Check if task has attachments and/or comments. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.
Adding the filter will do additional attachment and comments queries to the database,
it might slow down the query in case of tables having high volume of data.
This param is not considered for count queries

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for tasks that fulfill a given filter. This method is slightly more powerful
than the [Get Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/task/get-query/) method because it
allows filtering by multiple process or task variables of types `String`, `Number`
or `Boolean`. The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Task Count (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/task/post-query-count/) method.

**Security Consideration**:
There are several parameters (such as `assigneeExpression`) for specifying an EL
expression. These are disabled by default to prevent remote code execution. See the
section on
[security considerations for custom code](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
in the user guide for details.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

example-2.description: Logical query: assignee = "John Munda" AND (name = "Approve Invoice" OR priority = 5) AND (suspended = false OR taskDefinitionKey = "approveInvoice")

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the number of tasks that fulfill a provided filter. Corresponds to the size
of the result set when using the [Get Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/task/) method.

**Security Consideration:** There are several query parameters (such as
assigneeExpression) for specifying an EL expression. These are disabled by default to
prevent remote code execution. See the section on
[security considerations](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
for custom code in the user guide for details.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Restrict to task with the given id.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with any of the given ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given id.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key which 
is described by an expression. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with one of the give business keys. 
The keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring and is described by an expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given key.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with one of the given keys. The 
keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given name.

parameters.name: processDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process definition name that has the parameter value as 
a substring.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given business key.

parameters.name: caseInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case instance business key that has the parameter value 
as a substring.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given id.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given key.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given name.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case definition name that has the parameter value as a 
substring.

parameters.name: caseExecutionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case execution with the given id.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated activity 
instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated 
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user is assigned to.

parameters.name: assigneeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression is assigned to. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: assigneeLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter value described by the 
given expression as a substring. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are assigned to one of the passed and 
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: assigneeNotIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are not assigned to one of the passed and
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user owns.

parameters.name: ownerExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression owns. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateGroup
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given group.

parameters.name: candidateGroupLike
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to groups that have the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: candidateGroupExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the group described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateUser
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given user or to one of his groups.

parameters.name: candidateUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the user described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: includeAssignedTasks
parameters.description:
Also include tasks that are assigned to users in candidate queries. Default is to only 
include tasks that are not assigned to any user if you query by candidate user or
group(s).

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the given user is involved in. A user is involved in a task if 
an identity link exists between task and user (e.g., the user is the assignee).

parameters.name: involvedUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the user described by the given expression is involved in.
A user is involved in a task if an identity link exists between task and user
(e.g., the user is the assignee). See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are assigned.

parameters.name: unassigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given key.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have one of the given keys. The keys need to be in a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a key that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given name.

parameters.name: nameNotEqual
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that do not have the given name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a name with the given parameter value as substring.

parameters.name: nameNotLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that do not have a name with the given parameter
value as substring.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

parameters.name: descriptionLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a description that has the parameter
value as a substring.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given priority.

parameters.name: maxPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a lower or equal priority.

parameters.name: minPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a higher or equal priority.

parameters.name: dueDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: dueDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the date described by the given expression. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.435+0200`.

parameters.name: dueAfterExpression

[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)

`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueBefore
parameters.description:

[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have

`2013-01-23T14:42:45.243+0200`.

parameters.name: dueBeforeExpression

client applications. Additionally, the context path of the containing process
application is returned.

get.description:
Retrieves the form variables for a task. The form variables take form data specified
on the task into account. If form fields are defined, the variable types and default
values of the form fields are taken into account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variables for.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
id is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

200.description:

```
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

```
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"
                        Content-Type: application/json; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        ["foo","bar"]
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-3.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="myFile.txt"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"

                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
                        ```

schema.description: For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.description: A `/task/anId/rendered-form` HTML GET response body providing the rendered (generated) form content.

400.description:
The task with the given id does not exist or has no form field metadata defined for
this task. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Resolves a task and updates execution variables.

Resolving a task marks that the assignee is done with the task delegated to them, and
that it can be sent back to the owner. Can only be executed when the task has been
delegated. The assignee will be set to the owner, who performed the delegation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to resolve.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be
resumed successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Completes a task and updates process variables using a form submit. There are two
difference between this method and the `complete` method:

* If the task is in state `PENDING` - i.e., has been delegated before, it is not
completed but resolved. Otherwise it will be completed.
* If the task has Form Field Metadata defined, the process engine will perform backend
validation for any form fields which have validators defined.
See the
[Generated Task Forms](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/task-forms/_index/#generated-task-forms)
section of the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/) for more information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to submit the form for.

example-1.description: Response of a submitted task form with variables in return

200.description: Request successful. The response contains the process variables.

204.description: Request successful. The response contains no variables.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value
or the passed variable type is not supported.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for
the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be resumed successfully.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for
the error response format.

post.description: Resets a task's assignee. If successful, the task is not assigned to a user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to unclaim.

500.description:
The Task with the given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves all variables visible from the task. A variable is visible from the task if it is a local task
variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variables from.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on the server side (default `true`).
If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

500.description:
Task id is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables visible from the task. Updates precede deletions. So, if a variable is
updated AND deleted, the deletion overrides the update. A variable is visible from the task if it is a
local task variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to set variables for.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid. For example the value could not be parsed to an `Integer` value
or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Update or delete could not be executed because the task is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

delete.description:
Removes a variable that is visible to a task. A variable is visible to a task if it is a local task
variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to delete the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to be removed.

500.description:
Task id is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a variable from the context of a given task.
The variable must be visible from the task. It is visible from the task if it is a local task variable or
declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to get.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on the server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Task id is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

put.description:
Updates a process variable that is visible from the Task scope. A variable is visible from the task if it
is a local task variable, or declared in a parent scope of the task. See the documentation on
[variable scopes and visibility](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables#variable-scopes-and-variable-visibility).

**Note**: If a variable doesn't exist, the variable is created in the top-most scope
visible from the task.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to set the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to set.

400.description:
The variable name, value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an `Integer`
value or the passed variable type is not supported or a new transient variable has the name that is
already persisted. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
The variable name is `null`, or the Task id is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a binary variable from the context of a given task. Applicable for byte array and file
variables. The variable must be visible from the task. It is visible from the task if it is a local task
variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

200.description:
Request successful.
        For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.
        File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
        Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: binary variable: Status 200. Content-Type: application/octet-stream

schema.description:
File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
            Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

example-1.value: file variable: Status 200. Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="someFile.txt"

400.description:
Variable with given id exists but is not a binary variable.See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the serialized value for a binary variable or the binary value for a file variable visible from the
task. A variable is visible from the task if it is a local task variable or declared in a parent scope of
the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

requestBody.description: For binary variables a multipart form submit with the following parts:

example-1.description: Post binary content of a byte array variable.
example-1.value:
```
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="image.png"
                        Content-Type: application/octet-stream
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-2.description: Post the JSON serialization of a Java Class (**deprecated**).
example-2.value:
```
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="type"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"
                        Content-Type: application/json; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        ["foo","bar"]
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-3.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="myFile.txt"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        File
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if no filename is set. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Variable name is `null`, or the Task id is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Query for a list of tenants using a list of parameters. The size of the result set
can be retrieved by using the [Get Tenant
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/tenant/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the tenant.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the tenant.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by the name that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: userMember
parameters.description: Select only tenants where the given user is a member of.

parameters.name: groupMember
parameters.description: Select only tenants where the given group is a member of.

parameters.name: includingGroupsOfUser
parameters.description:
Select only tenants where the user or one of his groups is a member of.
Can only be used in combination with the `userMember` parameter. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy` is specified. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

options.description:
The `/tenant` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, this one for the resource
as such and one for individual tenant instances. The OPTIONS request
allows checking for the set of available operations that the currently
authenticated user can perform on the `/tenant` resource. If the user
can perform an operation or not may depend on various things,
including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and
the internal configuration of the process engine.

authorizations to interact with this resource and the internal configuration of the process
engine. `OPTIONS /user` returns available interactions on the resource.

get.description:
Query for variable instances that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the
properties of variable instances, such as the name or type. The size
of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get Variable Instance
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query-count/)
method.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: Filter by variable instance name.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the variable instance name. The parameter can include the wildcard `%` to
express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or
contains (`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
execution ids.

parameters.name: caseInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case instance ids.

parameters.name: caseExecutionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case execution ids.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated task
ids.

parameters.name: batchIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
batch ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
activity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variableValues
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances that have the certain values.
Value filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableName** and **variablename** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to
`true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableScopeIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of passed scope ids.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Query for variable instances that fulfill given parameters through a JSON object.
This method is slightly more powerful than the
[Get Variable Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/variable-
instance/get-query/) method because it allows filtering by multiple
variable instances of types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query/)

comparison is used. See the

post.description:
Query for the number of variable instances that fulfill given parameters. This
method takes the same message body as the
[Get Variable Instances POST](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/variable-
instance/post-query/) method and therefore it is slightly more
powerful than the [Get Variable Instance
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a variable by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the variable instance.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:**  While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the content of a variable by id. Applicable for byte array and file
variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the variable instance.

200.description:
Request successful. For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.
                      File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally, for file
                      variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

Files with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally, for file
                            responses, the Content-Disposition header will be set.

400.description:
Variable with given id exists but does not serialize as binary data. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves the version of the Rest API.

example-1.description: The Response content of a status 200

absoluteRemovalTime.description:
The date for which the instances shall be removed. Value may not be `null`.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `clearedRemovalTime` or `calculatedRemovalTime`.

clearedRemovalTime.description:
Sets the removal time to `null`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `absoluteRemovalTime` or `calculatedRemovalTime`.

calculatedRemovalTime.description:
The removal time is calculated based on the engine's configuration settings. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `absoluteRemovalTime` or `clearedRemovalTime`.

ActivityInstanceDto.description: A JSON object corresponding to the Activity Instance tree of the given process instance.

id.description: The id of the activity instance.

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The id of the parent activity instance, for example a sub process instance.

activityId.description: The id of the activity.

name.description: The name of the activity. This property is deprecated. Please use 'activityName'.

activityType.description: The type of activity (corresponds to the XML element name in the BPMN 2.0, e.g., 'userTask')

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance this activity instance is part of.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

childActivityInstances.description: A list of child activity instances.

childTransitionInstances.description:
A list of child transition instances.
A transition instance represents an execution waiting in an asynchronous continuation.

incidents.description:
A list of JSON objects containing incident specific properties:
* `id`: the id of the incident
* `activityId`: the activity id in which the incident occurred

id.description: The id of the incident.

activityId.description: The activity id in which the incident happened.

id.description: The id of the activity the results are aggregated for.

instances.description: The total number of running process instances of this activity.

failedJobs.description:
The total number of failed jobs for the running instances.
**Note**: Will be `0` (not `null`), if failed jobs were excluded.

incidents.description:
Each item in the resulting array is an object which contains `incidentType` and `incidentCount`.
**Note**: Will be an empty array, if `incidents` or `incidentsForType` were excluded.
Furthermore, the array will be also empty if no incidents were found.

@class.description:
The fully qualified class name of the data transfer object class.
The class name might change in future releases.

AnyValue.description:
Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.
 **Note**: Not every endpoint supports every type.

rel.description: The relation of the link to the object that belongs to.

id.description: The id of the task attachment.

name.description: The name of the task attachment.

description.description: The description of the task attachment.

taskId.description: The id of the task to which the attachment belongs.

type.description:
Indication of the type of content that this attachment refers to.
Can be MIME type or any other indication.

url.description: The url to the remote content of the task attachment.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the attachment should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process containing the task.

authenticated.description: A flag indicating if user is authenticated.

permissionName.description: Name of the permission which was checked.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource for which the permission check was performed.

resourceId.description: The id of the resource for which the permission check was performed.

authorized.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the user is authorized or not.

type.description:
The type of the authorization (0=global, 1=grant, 2=revoke). See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service.md#authorization-type)
for more information about authorization types.

permissions.description: An array of Strings holding the permissions provided by this authorization.

userId.description:
The id of the user this authorization has been created for. The value `*`
represents a global authorization ranging over all users.

groupId.description: The id of the group this authorization has been created for.

resourceType.description:
An integer representing the resource type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service/#resources)
for a list of integer representations of resource types.

resourceId.description:
The resource Id. The value `*` represents an authorization ranging over all
instances of a resource.

id.description: The id of the authorization.

The type of the authorization (0=global, 1=grant, 2=revoke). See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service.md#authorization-type)
for more information about authorization types.

permissions.description: An array of Strings holding the permissions provided by this authorization.

userId.description:
The id of the user this authorization has been created for. The value `*`
represents a global authorization ranging over all users.

groupId.description: The id of the group this authorization has been created for.

An integer representing the resource type. See the

for a list of integer representations of resource types.

resourceId.description:
The resource Id. The value `*` represents an authorization ranging over all
instances of a resource.

removalTime.description:
The removal time indicates the date a historic instance
authorization is cleaned up. A removal time can only be assigned to a historic
instance authorization. Can be `null` when not related to a historic instance
resource or when the removal time strategy is end and the root process instance
is not finished. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance the historic
instance authorization is related to. Can be `null` if not related to a historic instance
resource.

userId.description: The id of the user that does not have expected permissions

permissions.description: An array of Strings holding the permissions provided by this authorization.

userId.description:
The id of the user this authorization has been created for. The value `*`
represents a global authorization ranging over all users.

groupId.description: The id of the group this authorization has been created for.

resourceType.description:
An integer representing the resource type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service/#resources)
for a list of integer representations of resource types.

resourceId.description:
The resource Id. The value `*` represents an authorization ranging over all
instances of a resource.

id.description: The id of the batch.

type.description:
The type of the batch.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

totalJobs.description: The total jobs of a batch is the number of batch execution jobs required to complete the batch.

jobsCreated.description: The number of batch execution jobs already created by the seed job.

batchJobsPerSeed.description:
The number of batch execution jobs created per seed job invocation.
The batch seed job is invoked until it has created all batch execution jobs required by the batch
(see `totalJobs` property).

invocationsPerBatchJob.description:
Every batch execution job invokes the command executed by the batch `invocationsPerBatchJob` times.
E.g., for a process instance migration batch this specifies the number of process instances which are migrated per batch execution job.

seedJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the seed jobs of this batch.

monitorJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the monitor jobs of this batch.

batchJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the batch execution jobs of this batch.

suspended.description: Indicates whether this batch is suspended or not.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the batch.

createUserId.description: The id of the user that created the batch.

startTime.description:
The time the batch was started. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further information,
please see the [documentation] (https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

executionStartTime.description:
The time the batch execution was started, i.e., at least one batch job has been executed. Default
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further information, please see the [documentation]
(https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

remainingJobs.description:
The number of remaining batch execution jobs. This does include failed batch execution jobs and
batch execution jobs which still have to be created by the seed job.

completedJobs.description: The number of completed batch execution jobs. This does include aborted/deleted batch execution jobs.

failedJobs.description: The number of failed batch execution jobs. This does not include aborted or deleted batch execution jobs.

calledFromActivityIds.description: Ids of the CallActivities which call this process.

callingProcessDefinitionId.description: The id of the calling process definition

key.description: The key of the Camunda Form.

binding.description: The binding of the Camunda Form. Can be `latest`, `deployment` or `version`.

version.description: The specific version of a Camunda Form. This property is only set if `binding` is `version`.

id.description: The id of the case definition

key.description: The key of the case definition, i.e., the id of the CMMN 2.0 XML case definition.

category.description: The category of the case definition.

name.description: The name of the case definition.

version.description: The version of the case definition that the engine assigned to it.

resource.description: The file name of the case definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the case definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the case definition.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the case definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

valid.description: `true` if the password is compliant with the policy, otherwise `false`.
`true` if the password is compliant with this rule, otherwise `false`.

batchType.description: The type of the batch operation.

historyTimeToLive.description: The history time to live of the batch operation.

finishedBatchesCount.description: The count of the finished batch operations.

cleanableBatchesCount.description:
