The count of the cleanable historic batch operations, referring to history time to
live.

decisionDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision definition.

decisionDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision definition.

decisionDefinitionName.description: The name of the decision definition.

decisionDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the decision definition.

historyTimeToLive.description: The history time to live of the decision definition.

finishedDecisionInstanceCount.description: The count of the finished historic decision instances.

cleanableDecisionInstanceCount.description:
The count of the cleanable historic decision instances, referring to history time
to live.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decision definition.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition.

processDefinitionName.description: The name of the process definition.

processDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the process definition.

historyTimeToLive.description: The history time to live of the process definition.

finishedProcessInstanceCount.description: The count of the finished historic process instances.

cleanableProcessInstanceCount.description:
The count of the cleanable historic process instances, referring to history time to
live.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process definition.

id.description: The id of the task comment.

userId.description: The id of the user who created the comment.

taskId.description: The id of the task to which the comment belongs.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the comment is related to.

time.description:
The time when the comment was created.
[Default format]($(docsUrl)/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the comment should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format]($(docsUrl)/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing the task.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

localVariables.description: A JSON object containing local variable key-value pairs. Local variables are set only in the scope of external task. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs.

withVariablesInReturn.description:
Indicates whether the response should contain the process variables or not. The
default is `false` with a response code of `204`. If set to `true` the response
contains the process variables and has a response code of `200`. If the task is not
associated with a process instance (e.g. if it's part of a case instance) no
variables will be returned.

operator.description: Comparison operator to be used. `notLike` is not supported by all endpoints.

messageName.description: The name of the message to correlate. Corresponds to the 'name' element of the message defined in BPMN 2.0 XML. Can be null to correlate by other criteria only.

processInstanceIds.description:
A list of process instance ids that define a group of process instances
to which the operation will correlate a message.

Please note that if `processInstanceIds`, `processInstanceQuery` and `historicProcessInstanceQuery`
are defined, the resulting operation will be performed on the union of these sets.

variables.description: All variables the operation will set in the root scope of the process instances the message is correlated to.

messageName.description: The name of the message to deliver.

businessKey.description:
Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
Will only correlate to executions that belong to a process instance with the provided business key.

tenantId.description:
Used to correlate the message for a tenant with the given id.
Will only correlate to executions and process definitions which belong to the tenant.
Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `withoutTenantId`.

withoutTenantId.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should only be correlated to executions
and process definitions which belong to no tenant or not. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.
Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `tenantId`.

processInstanceId.description: Used to correlate the message to the process instance with the given id.

correlationKeys.description:
Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
Has to be a JSON object containing key-value pairs that are matched against process instance variables
during correlation. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the
following properties.

localCorrelationKeys.description:
Local variables used for correlation of executions (process instances) that wait for incoming messages.
Has to be a JSON object containing key-value pairs that are matched against local variables during correlation.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties.

processVariables.description:
A map of variables that is injected into the triggered execution or process instance after the message
has been delivered. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with
the following properties.

processVariablesLocal.description:
A map of local variables that is injected into the execution waiting on the message.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object
with the following properties.

processVariablesToTriggeredScope.description:
A map of variables that is injected into the new scope triggered by message correlation.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object
with the following properties.

all.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should be correlated to exactly one entity or multiple entities.
If the value is set to `false`, the message will be correlated to exactly one entity (execution or process definition).
If the value is set to `true`, the message will be correlated to multiple executions and a process definition that
can be instantiated by this message in one go.

resultEnabled.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the result of the correlation should be returned or not.
If this property is set to `true`, there will be returned a list of message correlation result objects. Depending on the
all property, there will be either one ore more returned results in the list.

The default value is `false`, which means no result will be returned.

variablesInResultEnabled.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the result of the correlation should contain process variables or not.
The parameter resultEnabled should be set to `true` in order to use this it.

The default value is `false`, which means the variables will not be returned.

resourceType.description: The resource type of the filter.

name.description: The name of the filter.

owner.description: The user id of the owner of the filter.

query.description: The query of the filter as a JSON object.

properties.description: The properties of a filter as a JSON object.

incidentType.description: A type of the new incident.

configuration.description: A configuration for the new incident.

message.description: A message for the new incident.

id.description: The id of the decision definition.

dmnXml.description:
An escaped XML string containing the XML that this decision definition was deployed with.
Carriage returns, line feeds and quotation marks are escaped.

id.description: The id of the decision definition

key.description: The key of the decision definition, i.e., the id of the DMN 1.0 XML decision definition.

category.description: The category of the decision definition.

name.description: The name of the decision definition.

version.description: The version of the decision definition that the engine assigned to it.

resource.description: The file name of the decision definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the decision definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decision definition.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the decision definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

versionTag.description: The version tag of the decision definition.

id.description: The id of the decision requirements definition.

key.description: The key of the decision requirements definition.

category.description: The category of the decision requirements definition.

name.description: The name of the decision requirements definition.

version.description:
The version of the decision requirements definition that the engine assigned to
it.

resource.description: The file name of the decision requirements definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the decision requirements definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decision requirements definition.

id.description: The id of the decision requirements definition.

dmnXml.description:
An escaped XML string containing the XML that this decision requirements definition
was deployed with. Carriage returns, line feeds and quotation marks
are escaped.

historicDecisionInstanceIds.description: A list of historic decision instance ids to delete.

historicProcessInstanceIds.description: A list historic process instance ids to delete.

failIfNotExists.description: If set to `false`, the request will still be successful if one ore more of the process ids are not found.

processInstanceIds.description: A list process instance ids to delete.

skipCustomListeners.description: Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

skipSubprocesses.description: Skip deletion of the subprocesses related to deleted processes as part of this request.

skipIoMappings.description:
Skip execution of [input/output variable mappings](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#input-output-variable-mapping)
for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

id.description: The id of the deployment.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the deployment.

deploymentTime.description: The time when the deployment was created.

name.description: The name of the deployment.

DeploymentResourceDto.title: DeploymentResourceDto
DeploymentResourceDto.description:
A JSON object corresponding to the `Resource` interface in the engine.
Its properties are as follows:

id.description: The id of the deployment resource.

name.description: The name of the deployment resource

deployedProcessDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the process definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the process definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the process definition.

deployedDecisionDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the decision definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the decision definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the decision definition.

deployedDecisionRequirementsDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the decision requirements definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the decision requirements definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the decision requirements definition.

deployedCaseDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the case definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the case definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the case definition.

period.description:
Specifies a timespan within a year.
**Note:** The period must be interpreted in conjunction with the returned `periodUnit`.

periodUnit.description: The unit of the given period. Possible values are `MONTH` and `QUARTER`.

minimum.description: The smallest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

maximum.description: The greatest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

average.description: The average duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

variables.description:
A map of variables which are used for evaluation of the conditions and are injected into the process instances which have been triggered.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties.

businessKey.description: Used for the process instances that have been triggered after the evaluation.

tenantId.description:
Used to evaluate a condition for a tenant with the given id.
Will only evaluate conditions of process definitions which belong to the tenant.

withoutTenantId.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the conditions should only be evaluated of process definitions which belong to no tenant or not.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

processDefinitionId.description: Used to evaluate conditions of the process definition with the given id.

id.description: The id of the event subscription.

eventType.description: The type of the event subscription.

eventName.description: The name of the event this subscription belongs to as defined in the process model.

executionId.description: The execution that is subscribed on the referenced event.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance this subscription belongs to.

activityId.description:
The identifier of the activity that this event subscription belongs to.
This could for example be the id of a receive task.

createdDate.description: The time this event subscription was created.

tenantId.description:
The id of the tenant this event subscription belongs to.
Can be `null` if the subscription belongs to no single tenant.

EventSubscriptionQueryDto.description: A event subscription query which retrieves a list of event subscriptions

eventSubscriptionId.description: The id of the event subscription.

eventName.description: The name of the event this subscription belongs to as defined in the process model.

eventType.description: The type of the event subscription.

executionId.description: The execution that is subscribed on the referenced event.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance this subscription belongs to.

activityId.description:
The identifier of the activity that this event subscription belongs to.
This could for example be the id of a receive task.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
Only select subscriptions that belong to one of the given tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only select subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

includeEventSubscriptionsWithoutTenantId.description:
Select event subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Can be used in combination with tenantIdIn parameter.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

type.description: An exception class indicating the occurred error.

message.description: A detailed message of the error.

code.description:
The code allows your client application to identify the error in an automated fashion.
You can look up the meaning of all built-in codes and learn how to add custom codes
in the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/error-handling/#exception-codes).

id.description: The id of the Execution.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the root of the execution tree representing the process instance.

ended.description: Indicates if the execution is ended.

tenantId.description:
The id of the tenant this execution belongs to. Can be `null`
if the execution belongs to no single tenant.

ExecutionQueryDto.description: A Execution instance query which defines a list of Execution instances

businessKey.description: Filter by the business key of the process instances the executions belong to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the executions run on.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the executions run on.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the id of the process instance the execution belongs to.

activityId.description: Filter by the id of the activity the execution currently executes.

signalEventSubscriptionName.description: Select only those executions that expect a signal of the given name.

messageEventSubscriptionName.description: Select only those executions that expect a message of the given name.

active.description:
Only include active executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

suspended.description:
Only include suspended executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

incidentType.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

incidentMessage.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

incidentMessageLike.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a  list of tenant ids. An execution must have one of the given
tenant ids.

variables.description:
An array to only include executions that have variables with certain values.

The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator`
and `value`.
`name (String)` is the variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison
operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.

processVariables.description:
An array to only include executions that belong to a process instance with variables
with certain values.

The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator`
and `value`.
`name (String)` is the variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison
operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Has no effect for the `/count` endpoint

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

variables.description:
A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and
each value a JSON variable value object.

newDuration.description:
An amount of time (in milliseconds). This is the new lock duration starting from the
current moment.

workerId.description:
The id of the worker that reports the failure. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently
locked the task.

ExternalTaskDto.title: ExternalTaskDto
ExternalTaskDto.description: An External Task object with the following properties

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this external task belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that the external task belongs to.

errorMessage.description:
The full error message submitted with the latest reported failure executing this task; `null` if no
failure was reported previously or if no error message was submitted

executionId.description: The id of the execution that the external task belongs to.

id.description: The id of the external task.

lockExpirationTime.description: The date that the task's most recent lock expires or has expired.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processDefinitionVersionTag.description: The version tag of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the external task belongs to.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant the external task belongs to.

retries.description: The number of retries the task currently has left.

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the external task is suspended or not.

workerId.description: The id of the worker that posesses or posessed the most recent lock.

topicName.description: The topic name of the external task.

priority.description: The priority of the external task.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance the external task belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An message indicating the reason of the failure.

retries.description:
A number of how often the task should be retried. Must be >= 0. If this is 0, an incident is created and
the task cannot be fetched anymore unless the retries are increased again. The incident's message is set
to the `errorMessage` parameter.

retryTimeout.description: A timeout in milliseconds before the external task becomes available again for fetching. Must be >= 0.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

localVariables.description: A JSON object containing local variable key-value pairs. Local variables are set only in the scope of external task. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

ExternalTaskQueryDto.title: ExternalTaskQueryDto
ExternalTaskQueryDto.description: A JSON object with the following properties:

externalTaskId.description: Filter by an external task's id.

externalTaskIdIn.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of external task ids.

topicName.description: Filter by an external task topic.

workerId.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

locked.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

notLocked.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

withRetriesLeft.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

noRetriesLeft.description:
Only include external tasks that have 0 retries. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any
external task.

lockExpirationAfter.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires after a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

lockExpirationBefore.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires before a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

activityId.description: Filter by the id of the activity that an external task is created for.

activityIdIn.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of ids of the activities that an external task is created for.

executionId.description: Filter by the id of the execution that an external task belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the id of the process instance that an external task belongs to.

processInstanceIdIn.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process instance ids that an external task may belong to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the id of the process definition that an external task belongs to.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
An external task must have one of the given tenant ids.

active.description: Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

suspended.description: Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

priorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

priorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

sorting.description:
A JSON array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is a JSON object that
                    specifies one ordering. The position in the array identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether
                    it is primary, secondary, etc. The ordering objects have the following properties:

                    **Note:** The `sorting` properties will not be applied to the External Task count query.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

lockDuration.description: **Mandatory.** The duration to lock the external tasks for in milliseconds.

variables.description:
A JSON array of `String` values that represent variable names. For each result task belonging to this
topic, the given variables are returned as well if they are accessible from the external task's
execution. If not provided - all variables will be fetched.

localVariables.description: If `true` only local variables will be fetched.

businessKey.description: A `String` value which enables the filtering of tasks based on process instance business key.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter tasks based on process definition id.

processDefinitionIdIn.description: Filter tasks based on process definition ids.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter tasks based on process definition key.

processDefinitionKeyIn.description: Filter tasks based on process definition keys.

processDefinitionVersionTag.description: Filter tasks based on process definition version tag.

tenantIdIn.description: Filter tasks based on tenant ids.

processVariables.description:
A `JSON` object used for filtering tasks based on process instance variable values. A property name of
the object represents a process variable name, while the property value represents the process variable
value to filter tasks by.

deserializeValues.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default `false`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature. Note
that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format. For example, a
variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

includeExtensionProperties.description:
Determines whether custom extension properties defined in the BPMN activity of the external task (e.g.
via the Extensions tab in the Camunda modeler) should be included in the response. Default: false

workerId.description:
**Mandatory.** The id of the worker on which behalf tasks are fetched. The returned tasks are locked for
that worker and can only be completed when providing the same worker id.

maxTasks.description: **Mandatory.** The maximum number of tasks to return.

usePriority.description:
A `boolean` value, which indicates whether the task should be fetched based on its priority
or arbitrarily.

asyncResponseTimeout.description:
The [Long Polling](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/external-tasks/#long-polling-to-fetch-and-lock-external-tasks)
timeout in milliseconds.

**Note:** The value cannot be set larger than 1.800.000 milliseconds (corresponds to 30 minutes).

topics.description:
A JSON array of topic objects for which external tasks should be fetched. The returned tasks may be
arbitrarily distributed among these topics. Each topic object has the following properties:

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

id.description: The id of the filter.

resourceType.description: The resource type of the filter.

name.description: The name of the filter.

owner.description: The user id of the owner of the filter.

query.description: The query of the filter as a JSON object.

properties.description: The properties of a filter as a JSON object.

itemCount.description:
The number of items matched by the filter itself. Note: Only exists
if the query parameter
`itemCount` was set to `true`

contextPath.description:
The context path of the process application. If the task (or the process definition) does not
belong to a process application deployment or a process definition at all, this
property is not set.

id.description: The id of the group.

name.description: The name of the group.

type.description: The type of the group.

GroupQueryDto.description: A group instance query which defines a list of group instances

id.description: Filter by the id of the group.

idIn.description: Filter by a JSON string array of group ids.

name.description: Filter by the name of the group.

nameLike.description: Filter by the name that the parameter is a substring of.

type.description: Filter by the type of the group.

member.description: Only retrieve groups where the given user id is a member of.

memberOfTenant.description: Only retrieve groups which are members of the given tenant.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

workerId.description:
**Mandatory.** The ID of the worker who is performing the operation on the external task.
If the task is already locked, must match the id of the worker who has most recently
locked the task.

id.description: The id of the activity instance.

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The id of the parent activity instance, for example a sub process instance.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this object is an instance of.

activityName.description: The name of the activity that this object is an instance of.

activityType.description: The type of the activity that this object is an instance of.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this activity instance belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this activity instance belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance that this activity instance belongs to.

executionId.description: The id of the execution that executed this activity instance.

taskId.description: The id of the task that is associated to this activity instance. Is only set if the activity is a user task.

assignee.description: The assignee of the task that is associated to this activity instance. Is only set if the activity is a user task.

calledProcessInstanceId.description: The id of the called process instance. Is only set if the activity is a call activity and the called instance a process instance.

calledCaseInstanceId.description: The id of the called case instance. Is only set if the activity is a call activity and the called instance a case instance.

startTime.description:
The time the instance was started. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

endTime.description:
The time the instance ended. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

durationInMillis.description: The time the instance took to finish (in milliseconds).

canceled.description: If `true`, this activity instance is canceled.

completeScope.description: If `true`, this activity instance did complete a BPMN 2.0 scope.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the activity instance.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the activity instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process containing this activity instance.

HistoricActivityInstanceQueryDto.description: A historic activity instance query which defines a group of historic activity instances

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by process definition id.

executionId.description: Filter by the id of the execution that executed the activity instance.

activityId.description: Filter by the activity id (according to BPMN 2.0 XML).

activityName.description: Filter by the activity name (according to BPMN 2.0 XML).

taskAssignee.description: Only include activity instances that are user tasks and assigned to a given user.

finished.description:
Only include finished activity instances.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

unfinished.description:
Only include unfinished activity instances.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

canceled.description:
Only include canceled activity instances.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

completeScope.description:
Only include activity instances which completed a scope.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

startedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

startedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

finishedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

finishedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

tenantIdIn.description: Must be a JSON array of Strings. An activity instance must have one of the given tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description: Only include historic activity instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

id.description: The id of the activity the results are aggregated for.

instances.description: The total number of all running instances of the activity.

canceled.description:
The total number of all canceled instances of the activity. **Note:** Will be `0`
(not `null`), if canceled activity instances were excluded.

finished.description:
The total number of all finished instances of the activity. **Note:** Will be `0`
(not `null`), if finished activity instances were excluded.

completeScope.description:
The total number of all instances which completed a scope of the activity.
**Note:** Will be `0` (not `null`), if activity instances which
completed a scope were excluded.

openIncidents.description:
The total number of open incidents for the activity. **Note:** Will be `0` (not
`null`), if `incidents` is set to `false`.

resolvedIncidents.description:
The total number of resolved incidents for the activity. **Note:** Will be `0` (not
`null`), if `incidents` is set to `false`.

deletedIncidents.description:
The total number of deleted incidents for the activity. **Note:** Will be `0` (not
`null`), if `incidents` is set to `false`.

id.description: The id of the batch.

type.description:
The type of the batch. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

totalJobs.description:
The total jobs of a batch is the number of batch execution
jobs required to complete the batch.

batchJobsPerSeed.description:
The number of batch execution jobs created per seed job invocation.
The batch seed job is invoked until it has created all batch
execution jobs required by the batch (see `totalJobs` property).

invocationsPerBatchJob.description:
Every batch execution job invokes the command executed by the batch
`invocationsPerBatchJob` times. E.g., for a process instance
migration batch this specifies the number of process instances
which are migrated per batch execution job.

seedJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the seed jobs of this batch.

monitorJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the monitor jobs of this batch.

batchJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the batch execution jobs of this batch.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the batch.

startTime.description:
The time the batch was started. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.
For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

executionStartTime.description:
The time the batch execution was started, i.e., at least one batch job has been executed. Default format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further information, please see the [documentation]
(https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

endTime.description:
The time the batch ended. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.
For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

removalTime.description:
The time after which the historic batch should be removed by the History Cleanup
job. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.
For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

HistoricBatchQueryDto.description: Query for the historic batches to set the removal time for.

type.description:
Filter by batch type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

completed.description:
Filter completed or not completed batches. If the value is
`true`, only completed batches, i.e., end time is set, are
returned. Otherwise, if the value is `false`, only running
batches, i.e., end time is null, are returned.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A batch matches if it has one of the given
tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description: Only include batches which belong to no tenant. Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Has no effect for the `/count` endpoint

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

id.description: The id of the decision input value.

decisionInstanceId.description: The id of the decision instance the input value belongs to.

clauseId.description: The id of the clause the input value belongs to.

clauseName.description: The name of the clause the input value belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An error message in case a Java Serialized Object could not be de-serialized.

type.description: The value type of the variable.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this entry.

value.description:
The variable's value. Value differs depending on the variable's type
and on the `disableCustomObjectDeserialization` parameter.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent
properties.

For variables of type `Object`, the following properties are
returned:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type
name.

* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store
the variable.

id.description: The id of the decision instance.

decisionDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision definition that this decision instance belongs to.

decisionDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision definition that this decision instance belongs to.

decisionDefinitionName.description: The name of the decision definition that this decision instance belongs to.

evaluationTime.description:
The time the instance was evaluated. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this decision instance belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this decision instance belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance that this decision instance belongs to.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition that this decision instance belongs to.

caseDefinitionKey.description: The key of the case definition that this decision instance belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance that this decision instance belongs to.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this decision instance belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that this decision instance belongs to.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the historic decision instance.

userId.description:
The id of the authenticated user that has evaluated this decision instance without
a process or case instance.

inputs.description:
The list of decision input values. **Only exists** if `includeInputs`
was set to `true` in the query.

outputs.description:
The list of decision output values. **Only exists** if `includeOutputs`
was set to `true` in the query.

collectResultValue.description:
The result of the collect aggregation of the decision result if used. `null` if no
aggregation was used.

rootDecisionInstanceId.description:
The decision instance id of the evaluated root decision. Can be `null` if this
instance is the root decision instance of the evaluation.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the evaluation
of this decision. Can be `null` if this decision instance is not
evaluated as part of a BPMN process.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description:
The id of the decision requirements definition that this decision instance belongs
to.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description:
The key of the decision requirements definition that this decision instance belongs
to.

HistoricDecisionInstanceQueryDto.description: A historic decision instance query which defines a list of historic decision instances

decisionInstanceIdIn.description: Filter by decision instance ids. Must be a comma-separated list of decision instance ids.

decisionDefinitionId.description: Filter by the decision definition the instances belongs to.

decisionDefinitionIdIn.description:
Filter by the decision definitions the instances belongs to. Must be a
comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

decisionDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the decision definition the instances belongs to.

decisionDefinitionKeyIn.description:
Filter by the keys of the decision definition the instances belongs to. Must be a comma-
separated list of decision definition keys.

decisionDefinitionName.description: Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to.

decisionDefinitionNameLike.description:
Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to, that the parameter
is a substring of.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the instances belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the process instance the instances belongs to.

caseDefinitionId.description: Filter by the case definition the instances belongs to.

caseDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the case definition the instances belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: Filter by the case instance the instances belongs to.

activityIdIn.description:
Filter by the activity ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity ids.

activityInstanceIdIn.description:
Filter by the activity instance ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity instance ids.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A historic decision instance must have one
of the given tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic decision instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

evaluatedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

evaluatedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

userId.description: Restrict to instances that were evaluated by the given user.

rootDecisionInstanceId.description:
Restrict to instances that have a given root decision instance id.
This also includes the decision instance with the given id.

rootDecisionInstancesOnly.description:
Restrict to instances those are the root decision instance of an evaluation.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description: Filter by the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

includeInputs.description:
Include input values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

includeOutputs.description:
Include output values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

disableBinaryFetching.description:
Disables fetching of byte array input and output values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

disableCustomObjectDeserialization.description:
Disables deserialization of input and output values that are custom objects.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

evaluations.description: A number of evaluation for decision definition.

id.description: The id of the decision output value.

decisionInstanceId.description: The id of the decision instance the output value belongs to.

clauseId.description: The id of the clause the output value belongs to.

clauseName.description: The name of the clause the output value belongs to.

ruleId.description: The id of the rule the output value belongs to.

ruleOrder.description: The order of the rule the output value belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An error message in case a Java Serialized Object could not be de-serialized.

variableName.description: The name of the output variable.

type.description: The value type of the variable.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this entry.

value.description:
The variable's value. Value differs depending on the variable's type
and on the `disableCustomObjectDeserialization` parameter.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent
properties.

For variables of type `Object`, the following properties are
returned:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type
name.

* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store
the variable.

id.description: The id of the historic detail.

type.description:
The type of the historic detail. Either `formField` for a submitted form field
value or `variableUpdate` for variable updates.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this historic detail belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this historic detail belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the historic detail belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance the historic detail belongs to.

executionId.description: The id of the execution the historic detail belongs to.

caseDefinitionKey.description: The key of the case definition that this historic detail belongs to.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition that this historic detail belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance the historic detail belongs to.

caseExecutionId.description: The id of the case execution the historic detail belongs to.

taskId.description: The id of the task the historic detail belongs to.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this historic detail belongs to.

userOperationId.description:
The id of user operation which links historic detail with
[user operation log](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/history/user-operation-log/)
entries.

time.description:
The time when this historic detail occurred. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the historic detail should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this historic detail.

fieldId.description:
The id of the form field.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `formField`.

fieldValue.description:
The submitted form field value. The value differs depending on the form field's type
and on the `deserializeValue` parameter.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `formField`.

variableName.description:
The name of the variable which has been updated.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

variableInstanceId.description:
The id of the associated variable instance.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

variableType.description:
The value type of the variable.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

value.description:
The variable's value. Value differs depending on the variable's type
and on the deserializeValues parameter.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent properties.
For variables of type `Object`, the following properties are returned:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type name.
* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store the variable.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

initial.description:
Returns `true` for variable updates that contains the initial values of the variables.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

revision.description:
The revision of the historic variable update.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

errorMessage.description:
An error message in case a Java Serialized Object
could not be de-serialized.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

HistoricDetailQueryDto.description: A historic detail query which defines a group of historic details.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processInstanceIdIn.description: Only include historic details which belong to one of the passed  process instance ids.

executionId.description: Filter by execution id.

variableTypeIn.description:
Only include historic details where the variable updates belong to one of the passed 
list of variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type `serializable`.

variableNameLike.description: Filter by variable name like. Example usage: `variableNameLike(%camunda%)`. The query will match the names of variables in a case-insensitive way.

tenantIdIn.description: Filter by a  list of tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic details that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

userOperationId.description: Filter by a user operation id.

formFields.description: Only include `HistoricFormFields`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

variableUpdates.description: Only include `HistoricVariableUpdates`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

excludeTaskDetails.description:
Excludes all task-related `HistoricDetails`, so only items which have no task id set will be selected.
When this parameter is used together with `taskId`, this call is ignored and task details are not excluded.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

initial.description:
Restrict to historic variable updates that contain only initial variable values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

occurredBefore.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured before the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

occurredAfter.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured after the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

sorting.description:
A JSON array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                    a JSON object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                    identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                    etc. Does not have an effect for the `count` endpoint.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

id.description: The id of the log entry.

externalTaskId.description: The id of the external task.

timestamp.description: The time when the log entry has been written.

topicName.description: The topic name of the associated external task.

workerId.description: The id of the worker that posessed the most recent lock.

retries.description: The number of retries the associated external task has left.

priority.description: The execution priority the external task had when the log entry was created.

errorMessage.description: The message of the error that occurred by executing the associated external task.

activityId.description: The id of the activity on which the associated external task was created.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance on which the associated external task was created.

executionId.description: The execution id on which the associated external task was created.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance on which the associated external task was created.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition which the associated external task belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition which the associated external task belongs to.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this historic external task log entry belongs to.

creationLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the creation of the associated
external task.

failureLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the failed execution of the
associated external task.

successLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the successful execution of the
associated external task.

deletionLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the deletion of the associated
external task.

removalTime.description:
The time after which this log should be removed by the History Cleanup job. Default
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.  For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this log.

HistoricExternalTaskLogQueryDto.description: A Historic External Task Log instance query which defines a list of Historic External Task Log instances

logId.description: Filter by historic external task log id.

topicName.description: Filter by an external task topic.

workerId.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

errorMessage.description: Filter by external task exception message.

activityIdIn.description: Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed activity ids.

activityInstanceIdIn.description:
Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed activity
instance ids.

executionIdIn.description: Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed execution ids.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by process definition id.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by process definition key.

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include historic external task log entries which belong to one of the passed and
comma-separated tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic external task log entries that belong to no tenant. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

priorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include logs for which the associated external task had a priority lower than or
equal to the given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

priorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include logs for which the associated external task had a priority higher than or
equal to the given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

creationLog.description: Only include creation logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

failureLog.description: Only include failure logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

successLog.description: Only include success logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

deletionLog.description: Only include deletion logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Sorting has no effect for `count` endpoints.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

id.description: Id of the Historic identity link entry.

time.description:
The time when the identity link is logged. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

type.description: The type of identity link (candidate/assignee/owner).

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the identity link should be removed by the History Cleanup job. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this identity link.

id.description: The id of the incident.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition this incident is associated with.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition this incident is associated with.

processInstanceId.description: The key of the process definition this incident is associated with.

executionId.description: The id of the execution this incident is associated with.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this incident.

endTime.description:
The time this incident has been deleted or resolved. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the incident should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

incidentType.description:
The type of incident, for example: `failedJobs` will be returned in case of an
incident which identified a failed job during the execution of a
process instance. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-
guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of
incident types.

activityId.description: The id of the activity this incident is associated with.

failedActivityId.description: The id of the activity on which the last exception occurred.

causeIncidentId.description: The id of the associated cause incident which has been triggered.

rootCauseIncidentId.description: The id of the associated root cause incident which has been triggered.

historyConfiguration.description: The payload of this incident at the time when it occurred.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant this incident is associated with.

jobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id the incident is associated with.

open.description: If true, this incident is open.

deleted.description: If true, this incident has been deleted.

resolved.description: If true, this incident has been resolved.

annotation.description: The annotation set to the incident.

id.description: The id of the log entry.

timestamp.description: The time when the log entry has been written.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the log entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further info see the
[docs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

jobId.description: The id of the associated job.

jobDueDate.description: The date on which the associated job is supposed to be processed.

jobRetries.description: The number of retries the associated job has left.

jobPriority.description: The execution priority the job had when the log entry was created.

jobExceptionMessage.description: The message of the exception that occurred by executing the associated job.

failedActivityId.description:
The id of the activity on which the last exception occurred by executing the
associated job.

jobDefinitionId.description: The id of the job definition on which the associated job was created.

jobDefinitionType.description:
The job definition type of the associated job. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job definition types.

jobDefinitionConfiguration.description: The job definition configuration type of the associated job.

activityId.description: The id of the activity on which the associated job was created.

executionId.description: The execution id on which the associated job was created.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance on which the associated job was created.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition which the associated job belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition which the associated job belongs to.

deploymentId.description: The id of the deployment which the associated job belongs to.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
which the associated job belongs to.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this historic job log entry belongs to.

hostname.description:
The name of the host of the Process Engine where the
job of this historic job log entry was executed.

batchId.description:
The ID of the batch associated with this job. `null` if no batch is associated with this job. The
following jobs are associated with batches:
* Seed Jobs
* Monitor Jobs
* Batch Execution Jobs

creationLog.description: A flag indicating whether this log represents the creation of the associated job.

failureLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the failed execution of the
associated job.

successLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the successful execution of the
associated job.

deletionLog.description: A flag indicating whether this log represents the deletion of the associated job.

HistoricJobLogQueryDto.description: A Historic Job Log instance query which defines a list of Historic Job Log instances

logId.description: Filter by historic job log id.

jobDefinitionType.description:
Filter by job definition type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job definition types.

activityIdIn.description: Only include historic job logs which belong to one of the passed activity ids.

failedActivityIdIn.description: Only include historic job logs which belong to failures of one of the passed activity ids.

executionIdIn.description: Only include historic job logs which belong to one of the passed execution ids.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by process definition id.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by process definition key.

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include historic job log entries which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated tenant ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic job log entries that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

jobPriorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include logs for which the associated job had a priority lower than or equal to the
given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

jobPriorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include logs for which the associated job had a priority higher than or equal to the
given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

creationLog.description: Only include creation logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

failureLog.description: Only include failure logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

successLog.description: Only include success logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

deletionLog.description: Only include deletion logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Sorting has no effect for `count` endpoints

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

id.description: The id of the process instance.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process.

superProcessInstanceId.description: The id of the parent process instance, if it exists.

superCaseInstanceId.description: The id of the parent case instance, if it exists.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the parent case instance, if it exists.

processDefinitionName.description: The name of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance.

startTime.description: The time the instance was started. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

endTime.description: The time the instance ended. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description: The time after which the instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.23/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

durationInMillis.description: The time the instance took to finish (in milliseconds).

startUserId.description: The id of the user who started the process instance.

startActivityId.description: The id of the initial activity that was executed (e.g., a start event).

deleteReason.description: The provided delete reason in case the process instance was canceled during execution.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process instance.

state.description:
Last state of the process instance, possible values are:

`ACTIVE` - running process instance

`SUSPENDED` - suspended process instances

`COMPLETED` - completed through normal end event

`EXTERNALLY_TERMINATED` - terminated externally, for instance through REST API

`INTERNALLY_TERMINATED` - terminated internally, for instance by terminating boundary event

restartedProcessInstanceId.description: The id of the original process instance which was restarted.

HistoricProcessInstanceQueryDto.description: A historic process instance query which defines a group of historic process instances

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processInstanceIds.description: Filter by process instance ids. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

processInstanceIdNotIn.description: Exclude instances by process instance ids. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the instances run on.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances run on.

processDefinitionKeyIn.description: Filter by a list of process definition keys. A process instance must have one of the given process definition keys. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

processDefinitionName.description: Filter by the name of the process definition the instances run on.

processDefinitionNameLike.description: Filter by process definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

processDefinitionKeyNotIn.description: Exclude instances that belong to a set of process definitions. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

processInstanceBusinessKey.description: Filter by process instance business key.

processInstanceBusinessKeyIn.description: Filter by a list of business keys. A process instance must have one of the given business keys. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`

processInstanceBusinessKeyLike.description: Filter by process instance business key that the parameter is a substring of.

rootProcessInstances.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are top level process instances.

finished.description:
Only include finished process instances. This flag includes all process instances
that are completed or terminated. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

unfinished.description: Only include unfinished process instances. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

withJobsRetrying.description:
Only include process instances which are associated with jobs that have encountered exceptions and still
have retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

withIncidents.description: Only include process instances which have an incident. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.
